intro: Wahlenbergia chondrophylla, commonly known as the silver bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its dense, silvery-gray foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in spring. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact growth habit and attractive appearance. Wahlenbergia chondrophylla thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
